memberdef.name: plp_mat_mult_cmplx_stride_q16

briefdescription.para: Glue code of strided matrix matrix multiplication for complex 16-bit fix-point.

parameterdescription.para: Points to the first input matrix of shape MxN
Points to the second input matrix of shape NxO
Height of matrix SrcA and DstC
Width of matrix SrcA and height of matrix SrcB
Width of matrix SrcB and DstC
Stride of input matrix A (elements between each row)
Stride of input matrix B (elements between each row)
Stride of output matrix C (Elements between each row)
Amount to shift the result of each multiplication ot the right
Points to the output matrix of shape MxO

simplesect.title: Fix-Point
simplesect.para: Fix-Point and Shifting The result will be shifted by the parameter shift to the right (which corresponds to a multiplication by 2^-shift). Assume that matrix A is represente as pSrcA * 2^-x and matrix B as pSrcB * 2^-y (which means that A has x, and B has y bits after the binary point). Then, the output matrix C is represented as pDstC * 2^-(x + y - shift). The output matrix is also stored with the same number of bits as the inputs. Set the shift parameter such that no overflow occurrs.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int16_t *__restrict__ pSrcA, const int16_t *__restrict__ pSrcB, uint32_t M, uint32_t N, uint32_t O, uint32_t strideA, uint32_t strideB, uint32_t strideC, uint32_t shift, uint32_t nPE, int16_t *__restrict__ pDstC)

memberdef.name: plp_mat_mult_cmplx_stride_q8_parallel

briefdescription.para: Glue code of parallel strided matrix matrix multiplication for complex 8-bit fix-point.

parameterdescription.para: Points to the first input matrix of shape MxN
Points to the second input matrix of shape NxO
Height of matrix SrcA and DstC
Width of matrix SrcA and height of matrix SrcB
Width of matrix SrcB and DstC
Stride of input matrix A (elements between each row)
Stride of input matrix B (elements between each row)
Stride of output matrix C (Elements between each row)
Amount to shift the result of each multiplication ot the right
Number of cores to use for computation
Points to the output matrix of shape MxO

simplesect.title: Fix-Point
simplesect.para: Fix-Point and Shifting The result will be shifted by the parameter shift to the right (which corresponds to a multiplication by 2^-shift). Assume that matrix A is represente as pSrcA * 2^-x and matrix B as pSrcB * 2^-y (which means that A has x, and B has y bits after the binary point). Then, the output matrix C is represented as pDstC * 2^-(x + y - shift). The output matrix is also stored with the same number of bits as the inputs. Set the shift parameter such that no overflow occurrs.

detaileddescription.para: This module contains the glue code for complex strided matrix matrix multiplication. The kernel codes (kernels) are in the Module Complex Matrix Matrix Multiplication Kernels.

The Matrix Matrix Multiplication computes the product of two matrices with dimensions MxN and NxO. The first matrix is accessed row wise, the second column wise, all values form the first are multiplied with the values of the second and then sum of the result gives the value for the result matrix. pDst[m,o] = pSrcA[m,0]*pSrcB[0,o] + pSrcA[m,1]*pSrcB[1,o] + ... + pSrcA[m,N-1]*pSrcB[N-1,o] These functions assume both source matrices (pSrcA and pSrcB) and the output matrix (pDstC) to be complex. They must be stored such that real and imaginary part of any element directly are directly next to eachother. The dimensionality (M, N, O) still counts the number of elements in each dimension, such that a complex matrix X with shape MxN has size M * N * 2. To access the real and imatinary part of this matrix X, do: Re(X[m, n]): pX[(m * N + n) * 2] Im(X[m, n]): pX[(m * N + n) * 2 + 1] There are functions for integer 32- 16- and 8-bit data types. For lower precision integers (16- and 8-bit), functions exploiting SIMD instructions are provided.

The naming scheme of the functions follows the following pattern (for example plp_mat_mult_cmplx_stride_i32): plp_<function name>_<data type><precision>[_parallel]
name
description
function_name
mat_mult_cmplx
data type
{f, i, q} respectively for floats, integers, fixed points
precision
{32, 16, 8} bits
